text.1:
Orang-orang musyrik Mekah ketika berkumpul di tempat pertemuan mereka yang berada di dekat Baitullah, sering membicarakan keadaan Nabi Muhammad dan Kitab Al-Qur'an yang dibawanya. Mereka sering bertanya satu sama lain bahwa apakah Muhammad itu seorang tukang sihir, penyair, atau seorang dukun tukang tenung yang terkena pengaruh buruk oleh berhala-berhala mereka? Mereka juga bertanya-tanya apakah Al-Qur'an itu sihir, syair, atau mantra-mantra saja? Masing-masing mengemukakan pendapat sesuai dengan hawa nafsu dan angan-angan mereka, sedangkan Nabi Muhammad sendiri dengan sikap yang tenang menyampaikan seruannya berdasarkan ayat-ayat Al-Qur'an yang memberi sinar penerangan kepada manusia menuju jalan kebenaran dan petunjuk yang lurus.

Selain itu mereka sering bercakap-cakap tentang hari kebangkitan sehingga sering menimbulkan perdebatan, sebab di antara mereka ada yang mengingkarinya dan beranggapan bahwa setelah mati habislah urusan mereka. Tidak ada lagi kebangkitan setelah mati. Mereka berpendapat bahwa manusia itu lahir ke dunia lalu ia mati dan ditelan bumi karena tidak ada yang membinasakan mereka kecuali masa atau waktu saja. Di sisi lain, ada pula di antara mereka yang berpendapat bahwa yang dibangkitkan itu hanya arwah saja dan bukan jasad yang telah habis dimakan bumi. Ada pula di antara mereka yang menjumpai salah seorang sahabat Nabi dan menanyakan tentang hal itu dengan sikap mencemoohkan.

Sehubungan dengan sikap mereka yang demikian itu, surah ini turun untuk menolak keingkaran mereka, dan mengemukakan argumen yang nyata bahwa Allah benar-benar Mahakuasa membangkitkan mereka kembali setelah mati, walaupun mereka telah menjadi tanah, dimakan binatang buas, ditelan ikan di laut, terbakar api dan diterbangkan angin, atau sebab lainnya.

Dalam ayat ini, Allah mencela perselisihan orang-orang kafir Mekah mengenai hari kebangkitan dengan mengatakan, "Tentang apakah orang-orang musyrik di kalangan penduduk Mekah itu saling bertanya-tanya?"

Allah menjawab pertanyaan mereka itu dengan firman-Nya. Yang dimaksud dengan berita yang sangat besar dalam ayat ini ialah berita tentang hari Kiamat. Disebut berita yang sangat besar karena hari Kiamat itu amat besar huru-haranya sebagaimana disebutkan dalam firman Allah:

Wahai manusia! Bertakwalah kepada Tuhanmu; sungguh, guncangan (hari) Kiamat itu adalah suatu (kejadian) yang sangat besar. (Ingatlah) pada hari ketika kamu melihatnya (guncangan itu), semua perempuan yang menyusui anaknya akan lalai terhadap anak yang disusuinya, dan setiap perempuan yang hamil akan keguguran kandungannya, dan kamu melihat manusia dalam keadaan mabuk, padahal sebenarnya mereka tidak mabuk, tetapi azab Allah itu sangat keras. (al-hajj/22: 1-2)

Meskipun begitu, orang-orang musyrik masih meragukan bahkan banyak yang tidak percaya, sebagaimana diterangkan Allah dalam firman-Nya:

(Kehidupan itu) tidak lain hanyalah kehidupan kita di dunia ini, (di sanalah) kita mati dan hidup dan tidak akan dibangkitkan (lagi). (al-Mu'minun/23: 37)

Firman Allah:

Kami tidak tahu apakah hari Kiamat itu, kami hanyalah menduga-duga saja, dan kami tidak yakin. (al-Jatsiyah/45: 32)

Adapun hikmah Ilahi menyampaikan persoalan ini dalam bentuk pertanyaan dan jawaban adalah agar lebih mendekatkan kepada pengertian dan penjelasan, seperti tercantum dalam firman Allah:

(Lalu Allah berfirman), "Milik siapakah kerajaan pada hari ini?" Milik Allah Yang Maha Esa, Maha Mengalahkan. (Gafir/40: 16)

Kemudian Allah menjawab pertanyaan mereka dengan nada ancaman, "Sekali-kali tidak. Jauh sekali dari kebenaran apa yang mereka anggap itu. Nanti mereka akan mengetahui pada waktu menyaksikan keadaan yang sebenarnya pada hari Kiamat yang selalu mereka ingkari."

Sebaiknya mereka jangan memperolok-olokkan karena mereka kelak pasti akan mengetahui keadaan yang sebenarnya. Apa-apa yang diragukan itu pasti akan mereka alami. Allah menguatkan firman-Nya itu dengan mengulang pernyataan itu sekali lagi.

Kemudian Allah menerangkan kekuasaan-Nya yang Mahaagung dan tanda-tanda rahmat-Nya yang sering dilupakan oleh mereka. Padahal tanda-tanda itu tampak jelas di hadapan mata. Allah mengemukakan sembilan perkara yang dapat mereka saksikan dengan mata sebagai bukti-bukti yang menunjukkan kekuasaan-Nya, seperti disebutkan pada ayat-ayat berikut, yaitu dari ayat 6 sampai ayat 14.

text.6: Pertama, bukankah Allah telah menjadikan bumi sebagai hamparan yang mudah didiami oleh manusia dan hewan ternak yang berguna bagi manusia. Sebetulnya bumi ini bundar seperti bola, tetapi karena begitu besarnya, maka permukaannya tampak datar seperti hamparan.

text.12:
Ketujuh, Allah membangun di atas manusia tujuh langit yang kokoh tanpa memiliki tiang dan tunduk kepada hukum Allah.

Secara ilmiah, tujuh langit yang kokoh kemungkinan dapat diartikan dengan lapisan-lapisan atmosfer yang dekat dengan bumi ini, seperti: (1) Troposphere (Troposfer), (2) Tropopause (Tropopaus), (3) Stratosphere (Stratosfer), (4) Stratopause (Stratopaus), (5) Mesosphere (Mesosfer), (6) Mesopause (Mesopause), dan (7) Thermosphere (Termosfer). Pembagian ini berdasarkan temperatur (suhu) dari lapisan-lapisan atmosfer dan jaraknya dari permukaan bumi. Kekokohan lapisan-lapisan tersebut, dalam pengertian kokoh dalam menyelimuti bola bumi kita, karena adanya gaya gravitasi bumi. (lihat pula telaah ilmiah dalam Surah ar-Ra'd/13:2, Juz-13). Pada telaah ilmiah Surah ar-Ra'd/13: 2 tersebut, pembagian lapisan atmosfer sedikit berbeda dengan yang dijelaskan pada telaah ilmiah ini, di mana Ionosfer dan Eksosfer disatukan dalam Termosfer. 

Namun apabila pengertian tujuh langit ini dikaitkan dengan Mi'raj Rasulullah Muhammad saw, tampak kurang tepat. Tujuh langit dalam Surah an-Naba'/78: 12 ini mungkin dapat diartikan sebagai Tujuh Dimensi Ruang-Waktu dalam Kaluza-Klein Theory (KKT). Seperti dinyatakan dalam fisika bahwa terdapat empat (4) Gaya Fundamental yang ada di jagad raya ini, yaitu Gaya Elektromagnetik, Gaya Nuklir Lemah, Gaya Nuklir Kuat, dan Gaya Gravitasi. Jika keempat gaya ini terbentuk dari Ledakan Besar (Big Bang) dari suatu Singularity, maka mestinya keempat gaya ini dahulunya 'menyatu sebagai Satu Gaya Tunggal (Grand Unified Force), ini yang dikenal dalam Grand Unified Theory (GUT, Teori Ketersatuan Agung?). KKT menjelaskan bahwa untuk dapat menerangkan ketersatuan gaya-gaya yang empat itu, maka adanya geometri ruang-waktu yang kita berada di dalamnya sekarang ini tidaklah cukup. Geometri ruang-waktu yang kita berada di dalamnya sekarang ini hanya mampu menjelaskan sedikit tentang gaya-gaya Elektromagnetik dan dalam beberapa hal Gaya Gravitasi. Untuk bisa menjelaskan keempat gaya tersebut, maka KKT menyatakan harus ada tujuh dimensi ruang-waktu (time-space dimensions) yang lain. Dengan demikian bersama empat dimensi yang sudah dikenal, yaitu: garis, bidang, ruang dan waktu; maka total dimensi ada sebelas (11) dimensi. Pernyataan ini berbasiskan pada perhitungan Matematika-Fisika. Berbasiskan pada KKT ini, para saintis telah mampu pula menghitung 'garis tengah salah satu dimensi ruang-waktu itu, yaitu sebesar 10-32 cm, jadi dimensi itu sangat kecil sekali. Dengan demikian, tidaklah mungkin dengan instrument yang ada sekarang ini kita dapat menembus tujuh dimensi ruang-waktu yang lain itu. Kaluza-Klein Theory telah memberikan gambaran adanya Tujuh Dimensi Ruang-Waktu, yang kesemuanya ini akan mengokohkan geometri jagad-raya dengan empat gaya-gaya fundamentalnya. Mungkinkah tujuh langit yang kokoh tersebut adalah tujuh dimensi ruang-waktu menurut Kaluza-Klein Theory ? Wallahu a'lam bis-sawab.

text.17: Dalam ayat ini, Allah menerangkan bahwa hari kebangkitan itu pasti terjadi pada waktu yang telah ditetapkan. Hal demikian terjadi karena muncul perubahan besar dalam susunan planet-planet di alam raya, yang menyebabkan perubahan dalam daya tarik dan perjalanan orbitnya. Kejadian itu menjurus ke arah kehancuran alam raya, dan juga kehancuran alam dunia.
text.20:

Akan tetapi jika didekati, ternyata tidak ada apa-apa karena bagian-bagiannya telah terpecah belah, dihancurkan, dan beterbangan ke mana-mana.

Firman Allah dalam hal ini:

Dan diangkatlah bumi dan gunung-gunung, lalu dibenturkan keduanya sekali benturan. (al-haqqah/69: 14)

Kemudian dalam ayat yang lain Allah berfirman:

Dan gunung-gunung dihancurluluhkan sehancur-hancurnya, maka jadilah ia debu yang beterbangan. (al-Waqi'ah/56: 5-6)

Kemudian gunung-gunung itu akan dihancurleburkan seperti debu yang beterbangan seperti dijelaskan dalam firman Allah:

Dan gunung-gunung seperti bulu yang dihambur-hamburkan. (al-Qari'ah/101: 5)

Ayat 17-20 dari Surah an-Naba'/78 di atas tampaknya berbicara mengenai terjadinya kiamat. Pada ayat yang dibahas, ada penggambaran mengenai tiupan sangkakala. Ada ayat lain yang juga menggunakan kata sangkakala atau trompet dalam menggambarkan kiamat, seperti Surah an-Nazi'at/79: 6-9, "(Sungguh, kamu akan dibangkitkan) pada hari ketika tiupan pertama mengguncangkan alam, (tiupan pertama) itu diiringi dengan tiupan kedua. Hati manusia pada waktu itu merasa sangat takut, pandangannya tunduk."

Keempat ayat di atas membahas tentang apa yang akan terjadi saat terjadinya hari kiamat. Salah satu kejadian pada hari itu adalah gempa bumi yang sangat dahsyat. Pada ayat 6-9 Surah an-Nazi'at/79, peristiwa gempa, mungkin saja bumi, digambarkan dengan kata "tiupan". 

Apabila kita perhatikan ayat 6 dan 7 dari Surah an-Nazi'at/79 di atas tampak adanya kemiripan dalam gambaran tentang hari kiamat. Namun ada dua pendapat mengenai penggambarannya. Di satu pihak, para ulama menginterpretasikan kata ar-rajifah sebagai bunyi trompet yang pertama, dan ar-radifah adalah tiupan trompet yang kedua. Di pihak lain, ar-rajifah dinyatakan sebagai bumi, dan ar-radifah sebagai saat terjadinya pengadilan. Ada juga yang menginterpretasikan ar-rajifah sebagai kekacauan dari unsur-unsur bumi, sedangkan ar-radifah adalah gempa buminya. Tampaknya pendapat terakhir yang lebih realistis. Tidak ada beda antara kekacauan unsur-unsur bumi dan gempa bumi.

Akan tetapi tampaknya ada pendapat lain yang lebih masuk akal. Mungkin kedua kata yang coba diinterpretasikan oleh banyak ulama sebenarnya menunjukkan adanya gempa utama dan gempa susulan, seperti dapat dilihat pada terjemahan dan tafsir ayat 6 dan 7 Surah an-Nazi'at/79 dalam Tafsir Al-Misbah, "Pada hari ketika berguncang-guncangan yang dahsyat, diikuti oleh yang mengiringi (nya)." 

Sebelum terjadinya gempa utama (main shock), beberapa gempa kecil (fore shock) akan mengawalinya. Setelah gempa utama terjadi maka diikuti oleh gempa susulan (after shocks) yang kekuatannya lebih kecil dan jumlahnya banyak sekali. Lambat laun gempa susulan ini menurun baik jumlah maupun kekuatannya. 

Perlu diketahui bahwa gempa awal sulit diidentifikasi. Umumnya gempa utama langsung datang, dan memorak-porandakan segalanya tanpa memperlihatkan adanya gempa awal. Sebagai gambaran adalah gempa Aceh yang terjadi pada tanggal 26 Desember 2004 dengan magnitudo Mw=9,3 datang tanpa gempa awal. Gempa yang mematahkan dasar laut sepanjang hampir 1000 km ini menimbulkan tsunami dan menghancurkan wilayah yang berada di sekitar Lautan Hindia. Gempa Aceh ini kemudian memicu gempa Nias dengan kekuatan sangat besar pula, yakni Mw=8,7. Jadi, pada hakikatnya gempa Nias bukan gempa susulan melainkan gempa yang dipicu oleh gempa besar yang pertama. Baik gempa Aceh maupun gempa Nias diikuti gempa susulan masing-masing. Dengan gambaran tersebut, gempa bumi yang datang pada hari kiamat akan jauh lebih dahsyat dan mampu memicu gempa-gempa yang sama dahsyatnya sehingga bumi hancur lebur.

Apabila dia sudah melewatinya, selamatlah dia dan jika tidak, dia akan tertahan."
text.22: Dijelaskan di sini bahwa neraka Jahanam itu menjadi tempat kembali bagi orang-orang yang durhaka dan melampaui batas, yang tidak mau mendengar ajakan para rasul yang membawa petunjuk dan kebenaran.

text.25: Selain air yang mendidih yang sampai kepada puncak panas, ada pula nanah yang sangat busuk baunya.

text.32: Di dalamnya terdapat berbagai nikmat, antara lain berupa kebun-kebun kurma dan buah anggur yang sangat lezat rasanya, cocok dengan selera, dan sedap dalam pandangan mata.

text.36: Dalam ayat ini diterangkan bahwa kemenangan dan kebahagiaan yang besar itu adalah pemberian yang banyak dari Allah, sebagai rahmat dan karunia-Nya kepada hamba yang taat kepada-Nya.
text.37: Dalam ayat ini, Allah menerangkan bahwa Dialah Tuhan Yang memelihara langit dan bumi dan segala yang berada di antaranya dengan sifat-Nya sebagai Tuhan Yang Maha Pemurah. text.40:
Ayat ini memberi peringatan kepada orang-orang kafir bahwa sesungguhnya Allah telah memberi peringatan kepada mereka dengan siksaan yang dekat.

Setiap orang harus mengerti bahwa apa saja yang akan dialaminya telah dekat waktu terjadinya. Soal jarak waktu bukanlah suatu hal yang penting, tetapi yang penting adalah peristiwa itu pasti akan dialaminya. Maka seorang yang berakal sehat selalu bersiap-siap untuk menghadapi peristiwa-peristiwa yang akan dijumpainya. Pada hari itu, manusia akan melihat apa yang telah diperbuat oleh kedua tangannya, sebagaimana dijelaskan pula dalam firman Allah:

(Ingatlah) pada hari (ketika) setiap jiwa mendapatkan (balasan) atas kebajikan yang telah dikerjakan dihadapkan kepadanya, (begitu juga balasan) atas kejahatan yang telah dia kerjakan. Dia berharap sekiranya ada jarak yang jauh antara dia dengan (hari) itu. (Ali 'Imran/3: 30)

Pada hari itu, orang kafir akan berkata dengan penuh kesedihan dan penyesalan, "Andaikata aku dahulu di dunia hanya menjadi tanah, dan tidak menjadi manusia yang durhaka kepada Tuhan."

text.1:
When the polytheists of Mecca gathered at their meeting place near the Baitullah, they often discussed the state of Prophet Muhammad and the Book of Al-Qur'an that he brought. They often asked each other whether Muhammad was a magician, a poet, or a sorcerer influenced by their idols? They also wondered if the Qur'an was magic, poetry, or just incantations? Each put forward opinions according to their desires and fantasies, while Prophet Muhammad himself, with a calm attitude, conveyed his call based on the verses of the Qur'an that gave light to mankind towards the path of truth and straight guidance.

In addition, they often talked about the Day of Resurrection, which often led to debates, because some of them denied it and assumed that after death their affairs were over. There is no resurrection after death. They argued that humans are born into the world, then they die and are swallowed by the earth because nothing destroys them except time. On the other hand, some of them argued that only the spirits would be resurrected, not the bodies that had been consumed by the earth. Some of them even met one of the Prophet's companions and asked about it with a mocking attitude.

In connection with their attitude, this surah was revealed to reject their denial, and to present a clear argument that Allah is truly All-Powerful to resurrect them after death, even though they have become soil, eaten by wild animals, swallowed by fish in the sea, burned by fire and blown by the wind, or other causes.

In this verse, Allah rebukes the disputes of the Meccan disbelievers regarding the Day of Resurrection by saying, "About what are the polytheists among the inhabitants of Mecca asking each other?"

Allah answers their question with His word. What is meant by the great news in this verse is the news about the Day of Judgment. It is called great news because the Day of Judgment is so great in its turmoil, as mentioned in Allah's word:

O mankind! Fear your Lord; indeed, the convulsion of the Hour is a terrible thing. On the Day you see it every nursing mother will be distracted from that [child] she was nursing, and every pregnant woman will abort her pregnancy, and you will see the people [appearing] intoxicated, but they are not intoxicated; but the punishment of Allah is severe. (al-Hajj/22: 1-2)

Even so, the polytheists still doubt and many do not believe, as Allah explains in His word:

There is not but our worldly life; we die and live, and we will not be resurrected. (al-Mu'minun/23: 37)

Allah's word:

We do not know what the Hour is. We think only that we are assuming, and we are not convinced. (al-Jatsiyah/45: 32)

As for the Divine wisdom in conveying this matter in the form of questions and answers, it is to bring it closer to understanding and explanation, as stated in Allah's word:

(Allah will say), "To whom belongs [all] sovereignty this Day?" [It belongs to] Allah, the One, the Prevailing. (Gafir/40: 16)

Then Allah answers their question with a tone of threat, "No! Far from the truth is what they assume. They will know when they witness the true state on the Day of Resurrection that they always deny."

They should not mock because they will surely know the true state. What is doubted will surely be experienced. Allah strengthens His word by repeating the statement once again.

Then Allah explains His Supreme power and the signs of His mercy that they often forget. Even though the signs are clearly visible before their eyes. Allah presents nine things that they can witness with their eyes as evidence that shows His power, as mentioned in the following verses, namely from verse 6 to verse 14.

text.6: Firstly, has not Allah made the earth a level expanse, easy to inhabit by humans and livestock that are useful to humans? In reality, the earth is round like a ball, but because it is so vast, its surface appears flat like a level expanse.
text.7: Secondly, Allah made the mountains as pegs to firmly establish the earth, so that it does not shake due to the tremors that are underneath it.
text.8:
Third, no less magnificent, Allah created humans in pairs, male and female, so that love and affection would arise between husband and wife to pursue a happy life and nurture good offspring, maintaining the continuity of the human species so that it does not become extinct.

This verse is in line with the meaning of Allah's word:

And of His signs is that He created for you from yourselves mates that you may find tranquility in them; and He placed between you affection and mercy. (ar-Rum/30: 21)
text.9: Fourth, Allah made sleep at night for rest from the busyness of work during the day, in order to produce various livelihoods. With the rest of sleep, humans can restore their power and strength to continue work the next day. If it were not interspersed with sleep, anyone's strength would certainly decline so that they could not carry out daily tasks.
text.10: Fifth, Allah made the night as clothing. Meaning, the darkness of night covers the surface of the earth just as clothing covers the human body. This means that the night functions as clothing for humans, able to cover their *aurat* while sleeping from the gaze of people who might see them. Similarly, as clothing, the darkness of night can protect and hide a sleeping person from danger or an enemy that is threatening.
text.11: Sixth, Allah made the day for striving and seeking sustenance necessary for life and for living in society.
text.12:
Seventh, Allah built above mankind seven firmaments (skies) that are without pillars and are subject to Allah's laws.

Scientifically, the seven firmaments can possibly be interpreted as the layers of the atmosphere close to the earth, such as: (1) Troposphere, (2) Tropopause, (3) Stratosphere, (4) Stratopause, (5) Mesosphere, (6) Mesopause, and (7) Thermosphere. This division is based on the temperature of the atmospheric layers and their distance from the earth's surface. The firmness of these layers, in the sense of firmly enveloping our globe, is due to the earth's gravitational force. (see also the scientific study in Surah ar-Ra'd/13:2, Juz-13). In the scientific study of Surah ar-Ra'd/13:2, the division of the atmospheric layers is slightly different from that explained in this scientific study, where the Ionosphere and Exosphere are combined into the Thermosphere.

However, if the meaning of these seven heavens is linked to the Mi'raj of the Prophet Muhammad saw, it seems less appropriate. The seven heavens in Surah an-Naba'/78:12 can perhaps be interpreted as the Seven Space-Time Dimensions in Kaluza-Klein Theory (KKT). As stated in physics, there are four (4) Fundamental Forces in the universe, namely the Electromagnetic Force, the Weak Nuclear Force, the Strong Nuclear Force, and the Gravitational Force. If these four forces were formed from the Big Bang from a Singularity, then these four forces must have previously 'united as a Single Force (Grand Unified Force), this is known in the Grand Unified Theory (GUT). KKT explains that in order to explain the unity of the four forces, the geometry of space-time in which we are now is not sufficient. The geometry of space-time in which we are now is only able to explain a little about Electromagnetic forces and in some cases Gravitational Force. To be able to explain all four forces, KKT states that there must be seven other space-time dimensions. Thus, together with the four dimensions that are already known, namely: line, plane, space and time; the total dimensions are eleven (11) dimensions. text.17: In this verse, Allah explains that the Day of Resurrection will certainly occur at the appointed time. On that day, the punishment that the disbelievers will receive in Hell and the reward that the believers will receive in Paradise will be decided, whether they are from the past, present, or future. There, their fate and lives will be vastly different according to the degree of their deeds when they were in the world. Allah has made that day the boundary between the world and the Hereafter, a place where all creatures will be gathered in Padang Mahsyar (the Plain of Gathering) so that each can see and witness what they have done during their life in the world, so that those who do good will receive their reward and those who do evil will receive punishment. Then, Allah explains the signs of that day and its terrors with His words in the following verse.
text.18:
On the Day of Judgment, the second trumpet will be blown by the angel Israfil, causing all creatures to be resurrected, rising from their respective graves and gathering in the Gathering Place (Padang Mahsyar). Each people will be led by their messenger, coming in groups as in the word of Allah.

(Remember) the Day We will call every people forth with their leader. (al-Isra'/17: 71)
text.19:
In this verse, Allah explains that on the Day of Judgment, the sky will open and have doors separating one part from another. The meaning is that the sky will be split into pieces, having gaps as if it were open and had doors. This is explained by another verse of Allah:

"When the sky is split open." (al-Insyiqaq/84: 1)

This happens because of major changes in the arrangement of planets in the universe, which cause changes in the gravitational pull and the paths of their orbits. This event leads to the destruction of the universe, and also the destruction of the world.
text.20:
In this verse, it is explained that the mountains on that day will no longer be as they were, but will be shaken until they are pulverized like a mist that from afar looks like a reflection of water. However, if approached, there is nothing there because its parts have been broken apart, destroyed, and scattered everywhere.

Allah's word in this regard:

And the earth and the mountains are lifted up and crushed with one crash. (al-Haqqah/69: 14)

Then in another verse, Allah says:

And the mountains will be crushed and pulverized, so they will become scattered dust. (al-Waqi'ah/56: 5-6)

Then the mountains will be pulverized like scattered dust as explained in Allah's word:

And the mountains will be like wool, scattered about. (al-Qari'ah/101: 5)

Verses 17-20 of Surah an-Naba'/78 above seem to be talking about the occurrence of the Day of Judgment. In the verse being discussed, there is a description of the blowing of the trumpet. There are other verses that also use the word trumpet or horn in describing the Day of Judgment, such as Surah an-Nazi'at/79: 6-9, "(Indeed, you will be resurrected) on the Day the first blast shakes [creation], followed by the second blast. Hearts, that Day, will tremble, their eyes lowered."

The four verses above discuss what will happen when the Day of Judgment occurs. One of the events on that day is a very powerful earthquake. In verses 6-9 of Surah an-Nazi'at/79, the earthquake, perhaps of the earth, is described with the word "blast."

If we pay attention to verses 6 and 7 of Surah an-Nazi'at/79 above, there seems to be a similarity in the description of the Day of Judgment. However, there are two opinions regarding the description. On the one hand, the scholars interpret the word *ar-rajifah* as the first trumpet blast, and *ar-radifah* as the second trumpet blast. On the other hand, *ar-rajifah* is stated as the earth, and *ar-radifah* as the time of judgment. There are also those who interpret *ar-rajifah* as the chaos of the elements of the earth, while *ar-radifah* is the earthquake. It seems that the latter opinion is more realistic. There is no difference between the chaos of the elements of the earth and the earthquake.

However, there seems to be another opinion that is more reasonable. Perhaps the two words that many scholars are trying to interpret actually indicate the main shock and aftershocks, as can be seen in the translation and interpretation of verses 6 and 7 of Surah an-Nazi'at/79 in Tafsir Al-Misbah, "On the Day when the quaking one quakes, followed by the succeeding one."

Before the main shock, several small earthquakes (foreshocks) will precede it. After the main shock occurs, it is followed by aftershocks that are smaller in strength and numerous. Gradually, these aftershocks decrease in both number and strength.

It should be noted that early earthquakes are difficult to identify. Generally, the main earthquake comes directly, and devastates everything without showing any early earthquakes. As an illustration, the Aceh earthquake that occurred on December 26, 2004 with a magnitude of Mw=9.3 came without an early earthquake. The earthquake that broke the seabed along almost 1000 km caused a tsunami and destroyed the area around the Indian Ocean. The Aceh earthquake then triggered the Nias earthquake with a very large force, namely Mw=8.7. So, in essence, the Nias earthquake was not an aftershock but an earthquake triggered by the first major earthquake. Both the Aceh earthquake and the Nias earthquake were followed by aftershocks respectively. With this illustration, the earthquake that comes on the Day of Judgment will be far more devastating and able to trigger earthquakes of the same magnitude so that the earth is destroyed.
text.21: Indeed, the place for the execution of Allah's punishment is Hell Jahannam, which is always waiting for the arrival of the disbelievers to be punished within it. It is narrated by Ibn Jarir and Ibn Mundhir from al-Hasan al-Basri, "No one enters Paradise except after passing through Hell. If he passes through it, he is saved, and if not, he will be detained."
text.22: It is explained here that the Hell of Jahannam becomes the place of return for those who are disobedient and transgress beyond bounds, who do not want to listen to the calls of the messengers who bring guidance and truth.
text.23:
They will reside in hell for a long time, as explained in Allah's word:

They will want to get out of the Fire, but never will they get out therefrom; and theirs will be a lasting torment. (al-Ma'idah/5: 37)
text.24: In Hell Jahannam, they will not taste any coolness that can reduce the intensely scorching heat, nor will they receive any drink that can quench their thirst.
text.25: Besides boiling water that reaches the peak of heat, there is also pus with a very foul odor.
text.26: Hell Jahannam is prepared as a recompense from Allah commensurate with the sins and transgressions they committed in the world, because every evil and wickedness will be repaid with evil and wickedness that is equivalent. This commensurate punishment is given because of the very grave sin they committed, which is associating partners with Allah (shirk). They will be burned in Hell Jahannam for a very long time.
text.27: After broadly explaining the torment of hell in the previous verses, in the following verses Allah mentions the details of that sin, which is divided into two parts: first, they do not fear the Day of Reckoning because they deny its coming. Therefore, they are not afraid to commit those transgressions according to the promptings of their desires (hawa nafsu). Second, they deny the verses of Allah and what is mentioned in the Qur'an about the obligation to monotheize Allah in accordance with the call of the messengers and to believe in the Day of Resurrection.
text.28: After outlining the punishment of Hell in general terms in the previous verses, in the following verses Allah mentions the details of that sin, which is divided into two parts: first, they do not fear the Day of Reckoning because they deny its coming. Therefore, they are not afraid to commit those transgressions according to the promptings of their desires (hawa nafsu). Second, they deny the verses of Allah and what is mentioned in the Al-Qur'an about the obligation to monotheize Allah (tauhid) according to the call of the messengers and to believe in the Day of Resurrection.
text.29: After explaining their evil deeds and misguided beliefs, Allah in this verse explains that everything they did has been accounted for according to the records that are with Him. All of mankind's deeds in their entirety have been recorded in His records, nothing is left out, not even the slightest bit.
text.30: In this verse, Allah explains that as a consequence of their disbelief and disobedience, they will feel His torment. Allah will not increase them except with a more painful punishment.
text.31: In this verse, Allah explains that those who are righteous will indeed attain victory and happiness with great honor and reward in Paradise.
text.32: Within it are various blessings, including gardens of date palms and grapes that are very delicious in taste, suited to the palate, and pleasing to the eye.
text.33: Then it is also explained that in Paradise there are many beautiful, full-figured, and of similar age houris. The pleasure of associating with women, which is usually a peak pleasure in the world, will also be experienced by the people of Paradise in a more perfect way, but it cannot be imagined how it will happen later.
text.34:
In it (Paradise) there are also servings of drinks packaged in full glasses. In another verse of Allah it is stated:

And they will be given to drink there a cup [of wine] mixed with ginger. (al-Insan/76: 17)
text.35:
In Paradise, they will not hear meaningless or futile speech, nor will they hear lying speech, even though they drink wine, as explained in Allah's saying:

(There) they pass from hand to hand a cup wherein is neither any vain discourse nor any sinful act. (ath-Thur/52:23)
text.36: In this verse, it is explained that victory and great happiness are a bountiful gift from Allah, as a mercy and grace from Him to the servant who is obedient to Him.
text.37: In this verse, Allah explains that He is the Lord Who sustains the heavens and the earth and everything in between with His attribute as the Most Gracious (Ar-Rahman). Allah's greatness on the Day of Judgment will be very apparent; no one will speak to Allah except with His permission.
text.38: In this verse, Allah explains that on the Day of Resurrection, the Angel Gabriel and other angels will stand in rows awaiting Allah's command. They will not say anything except after being given permission by Allah, the Most Gracious. And the words they utter at that time will only be words of truth.
text.39: In this verse, Allah explains that the Day of Judgment is certain to occur and matters that were previously concealed or hidden will surely be revealed. Likewise, whatever is stored in the hearts of humans will certainly be shown on that day. Therefore, Allah encourages them to draw closer to Him and perform deeds that distance themselves from His punishment. Thus, they will surely tread the path back to their Lord with complete happiness.
text.40:
This verse gives a warning to the disbelievers that indeed Allah has given them a warning of a punishment that is near.

Everyone must understand that whatever they will experience is near in its time of occurrence. The matter of the distance of time is not important, but what is important is that the event will surely be experienced. Therefore, a person of sound mind always prepares to face the events that will be encountered. On that Day, people will see what their hands have done, as also explained in Allah's word:

(Remember) the Day when every soul will find present whatever good it has done, and whatever evil it has done, it will wish that there was between itself and that [evil] a great distance. (Ali 'Imran/3: 30)

On that Day, the disbeliever will say with full sadness and regret, "Oh, would that I were dust [i.e., nonexistent] and had not been a human being who disobeyed the Lord."
